\]

metadata.ground_truth: \(\{(x, y, z, w) \mid x = -1 \text{ or } y = -2 \text{ or } z = -3 \text{ or } w = -4\}\)

x^2 + 3xz + z^2 = 1 \\

Solve the following math problem step by step. At the end, output your final answer inside \boxed{}.

Find all functions \( f: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R} \) such that

\[ f\left(x + f\left(x+y\right)\right) = f\left(x-y\right) + f\left(f\left(x\right)\right) \]

holds for all reals \( x \) and \( y \).

metadata.ground_truth:
\( f(x) = -a(x) \) where \( A, B \) are any two supplementary vector spaces of the \(\mathbb{Q}\)-vector space \(\mathbb{R}\), and \( a(x) \) is the projection of \( x \) onto \( A \). 

In simpler terms, the solutions are all additive functions of the form \( f(x) = -x \) or more generally, \( f(x) = -a(x) \) where \( a(x) \) is the projection onto a subspace \( A \) of \(\mathbb{R}\) over \(\mathbb{Q}\).

Given the function \( g(n) \) defined as:
\[ g(n) = \begin{cases} 
1 & \text{if } n \geq 1, \\
0 & \text{if } n \leq 0,
\end{cases} \]
and the function \( f(n, m) \) defined for all integers \( n \geq 0 \) and \( m \geq 0 \) by:
\[ f(0, m) = 0, \]
\[ f(n+1, m) = \left(1 - g(m) + g(m) \cdot g(m - 1 - f(n, m))\right) \cdot \left(1 + f(n, m)\right), \]
find all possible functions \( f(n, m) \) that satisfy these conditions for all integers \( n \geq 0 \) and \( m \geq 0 \).

metadata.ground_truth:
\( f(n, m) = \begin{cases} 
n & \text{if } m = 0, \\
n \mod m & \text{if } m \neq 0.
\end{cases} \)
